descriptor.name: Johnson's Baby Baby Lotion, 250 Ml
descriptor.short_desc: Johnson's baby lotion is suitable for a newborn. With 24 hour moisture, prevents moisture loss and protects baby's skin barrier. Baby soft skin, all day long, it has a non-greasy formula for quick absorption. Clinically mildness proven. It is made with natural plant oil. Recommended by doctors, it is pH balanced and hypoallergenic. No added parabens, sulfates or dyes.

descriptor.name: Nestle Cerelac Multigrain Dal Veg Baby Cereal With Milk From 12 Months + 300G
descriptor.short_desc: Nestle Cerelac Multigrain Dal Veg Baby Cereal with Milk, typically available in a 300-gram pack, is a nutritious and convenient baby cereal designed for infants aged 12 months and older. This cereal offers a balanced combination of multigrains, lentils, vegetables, and milk, providing essential nutrients for a growing child. Nestle Cerelac is a trusted brand in baby nutrition, and this product is a popular choice for parents looking to introduce their little ones to a wholesome and easy-to-prepare meal that supports their development and dietary needs.

descriptor.name: Nestle Cerelac Baby Cereal With Milk, Wheat Apple Cherry - From 8 To 24 Months, 300 G Bag-In-Box
descriptor.short_desc: Nestle Cerelac Baby Cereal with Milk - Wheat Apple Cherry is a complementary food for babies from 8 to 24 months. While infants and children have higher requirements of nutrients than adults, 2 serves of Cerelac Wheat Apple Cherry provides 37% of a baby's daily need of iron. It is also a source of 14 important nutrients including vitamins and minerals. Nestle develops infant nutrition products backed by evolving science and research. Innovation has been at the heart of Nestle since its beginning. Optimal Preparation: Careful and hygienic preparation of Infant food is most essential for health. Do not use fewer scoops than directed, since diluted feeding will not provide adequate nutrients needed by your infant. Do not use more scoops than directed since concentrated feed will not provide the water needed by your infant. Wash and dry your hands before preparing baby's food. Make sure all utensils are thoroughly clean. Safety Warnings: Infant food should be used only on the advice of a health worker as to the need for its use and the proper method of its use. Infant food is not the sole source of nourishment for an infant. Use prepared feed within half an hour otherwise microbial deterioration may set in. Discard unused feed.
